net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class AbstractProcessManager

  • Object
    • AbstractProcessManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProcessManager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleProcessManager

    public abstract class AbstractProcessManager
extends Object
implements ProcessManager
    An abstract implementation of the ProcessManager interface.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected AbstractProcessManager(ProcessBuilder builder, long keepAliveTime)
      Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder with the specified maximum life span.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getKeepAliveTime()
      Determines the duration of continuous idleness after which the process is to be terminated.
      Process start()
      A method that starts a new process.

      • Methods inherited from interface ProcessManager

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractProcessManager

        protected AbstractProcessManager(ProcessBuilder builder,
                                 long keepAliveTime)
        Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder with the specified maximum life span.
        Parameters:
        builder - The instance to build the processes with.
        keepAliveTime - The number of milliseconds after which idle processes are terminated. If it is 0 or less, the life span of the process will not be limited.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public Process start()
              throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        A method that starts a new process. The process created should always be the same and it should always be started only upon the call of this method.
        Specified by:
        start in interface ProcessManager
        Returns:
        A new process.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the process cannot be started.

      • getKeepAliveTime

        public long getKeepAliveTime()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        Determines the duration of continuous idleness after which the process is to be terminated. The process is considered idle if it is started up and not processing a submission. If it returns 0 or less, the life span of the process is not limited. By default, it returns 0.
        Specified by:
        getKeepAliveTime in interface ProcessManager
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds of idleness after which the process is to be terminated.
